isis.stitle: CAB: 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 AND 8600 MODELS - INSTALL - CAB DOOR LOCK CYLINDER

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Door Lock Cylinder on Front Cab Door of Standard Cab or Extended Cab Models and on Front and Rear Cab Doors of Crew Cab Models
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 79 for Items in parentheses.

The cab door lock cylinder (Item 7) on the front doors of standard cab or extended cab models and front and rear doors of crew cab models are key coded the same as the ignition switch on instrument panel, so that one key operates both the ignition switch and door locks.

step1.para: Position cab door lock cylinder (Item 7) back in the cavity of the outer cab door handle (Item 6), make sure cab door lock cylinder is positioned properly. Install retaining clip (Item 5) securing it in outer cab door handle , driver side shown.
Once the cab door lock cylinder (Item 7) has been secured in the outer cab door handle (Item 6). Make sure the cab door lock cylinder is working properly before proceeding.

note.para: A new outer cab door handle trim bezel (Item 3) will need to be installed if the plastic tabs securing it to the cab door, broke off during removal.

step1.para: Position four plastic tabs of the outer cab door handle trim bezel (Item 3) into mounting holes in the outer cab door handle (Item 6) and carefully push it in place to secure it , driver side shown.
Repeat procedure to install passenger side cab door lock cylinder into front or rear cab doors.
